article.headline: N.C.-Asheville 61, Coastal Carolina 58
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. -- Matt Dickey hit a 3-pointer with 1 second left and North Carolina-Asheville knocked off Coastal Carolina 61-58 on Tuesday night to split the season series. The Bulldogs (14-13, 9-7 Big South Conference), coming off two losses in which they led by double-digits at halftime, trailed 45-41 with 10:15 left. After a 9-0 UNC Asheville run, the Chanticleers regained the lead at 57-56. The Bulldogs pushed ahead on two J.P. Primm free throws, then Danny Nieman's foul shot with 1:36 left tied it at 58. Dickey's buzzer-beating trey snapped Coastal Carolina's four-game winning streak in the series, including 80-59 on Jan. 20. Jaron Lane led UNC Asheville with 16 points. With leading scorer Desmond Holloway suspended indefinitely for an eligibility issue, Anthony Raffa scored 15 to lead the Chanticleers (25-4, 15-2), who are still trying to clinch the league regular-season title.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
